author: Mike Brest
title: Houthi-targeted tanker in Red Sea now posing environmental threat
text: The [Houthis](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/houthis) attacked a [Greek](http://washingtonexaminer.com/tag/greece/)-flagged oil tanker in the [Red Sea](http://washingtonexaminer.com/tag/red-sea/), which now poses a significant environmental threat to the area. A European Union naval mission said the Sounion came under attack and lost its engine power. Upon request, officials dispatched the EUNAVFOR ASPIDES ship to aid the vessel in distress, and the ship was able to destroy an unmanned surface vessel and rescue the crew. The Houthis took [credit](https://x.com/army21ye/status/1826685095400648767) for the attack and said the ship is now at risk of sinking. They also announced responsibility for a separate attack on a different vessel. The ship was transiting approximately 1 million barrels of crude oil, deputy Pentagon spokeswoman Sabrina Singh said Thursday. She said it was ‚Äúpotentially an environmental catastrophe ‚Ä¶ in the Houthis backyard.‚Äù The [Yemen](https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/tag/yemen)-based Houthis have carried out dozens of attacks on commercial shipping vessels transiting the waterways off the country‚Äôs coasts, forcing global shipping companies to avoid those routes for longer and more expensive alternatives. Abda Sharif, the British ambassador to Yemen, called the Houthi attacks ‚Äúillegal and reckless,‚Äù and said, ‚ÄúAnother Houthi attack threatens Yemen‚Äôs coastline, fishing industry and environmental catastrophe.‚Äù The Houthis have claimed they are carrying out these attacks in solidarity with Palestinians given Israel‚Äôs war against Hamas, however, they have attacked ships completely unrelated to Israel or the United States. Over the several months they have consistently carried out these attacks, the Houthis have sunk two vessels and seized a third, killed at least three sailors, kidnapped others, and forced global shipping companies to avoid the Suez Canal for much longer and more expensive routes. U.S. forces in the Middle East frequently prevent or defend commercial vessels from attacks, and the U.S. and the United Kingdom have carried out strikes against the Houthis a handful of times since this conflict emerged last November. [CLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER](http://washingtonexaminer.com/) ‚ÄúSo the simple answer is yes, we have been successful in degrading their capabilities,‚Äù Singh said. ‚ÄúThey still maintain a robust arsenal, but we have been able to degrade their capabilities over time, and we have been able to protect ships that transit the Red Sea with our alliance through Operation Prosperity Guardian.‚Äù The Houthis are one of several proxy groups Iran has supported and funded for decades.

author: Mcmey1
title: #28 Gobernando el PP en 2001 a estos jueces conservadores les parec√≠a intolerable que el CGPJ llevase 2 MESES sin renovar
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
Solamente van a por su propio inter√©s, descaradamente. TODO lo que dicen son excusas fabricadas para el caso concreto.
Ta est√°n atacando otra vez a la independencia de los jueces estos rojos masones. Independencia para defender hoy una cosa y ma√±ana la contraria seg√∫n les convenga.
[#5](c5#c-5) Eso es una burla a la democracia. Los √≥rganos de gobierno del poder judicial deben representar, al igual que el parlamento, las proporciones ideol√≥gicas votadas por el pueblo de cuya soberan√≠a emana el poder. Cada vez est√° m√°s claro que el poder judicial en Espa√±a es bastante poco democr√°tico. Atado y bien atado.
[#9](c9#c-9) Eso es una barbaridad. Es como si los pol√≠ticos tambi√©n decidieran elegirse entre ellos. Lo ver√≠amos algo absolutamente intolerable, una propuesta golpista. El poder judicial no es un poder diferente ni del legislativo, ni del ejecutivo. En estos momentos, los jueces que dirigen los √≥rganos del poder judicial son usurpadores y deber√≠amos tratarlos como a tales.
[#22](c22#c-22) Es una idea que han propuesto algunos que no tiene ni pies ni cabeza.
Art√≠culo 1 de la Constituci√≥n Espa√±ola:
2. La soberan√≠a nacional reside en el pueblo espa√±ol, del que emanan los poderes del Estado.
Si el poder judicial se eligiera a si mismo, dejar√≠a de emanar del pueblo espa√±ol y, por lo tanto, ser√≠a contrario a la Constituci√≥n.
[#11](c11#c-11) El poder ejecutivo es elegido por el Parlamento, que a su vez es el poder legislativo. Es de pura l√≥gica, por lo tanto, que la distribuci√≥n del poder judicial sea acorde a esta. Y ya. Todas las dem√°s propuestas que no tienen otro objetivo, m√°s o menos declarado, que mantener un poder conservador en los √≥rganos de poder judiciales independientemente de la voluntad popular son ajenas al esp√≠ritu de la Constituci√≥n que la derecha tant√≠simo dice amar y respetar.
En serio al PP le merece la pena quemar de esta manera a la judicatura para salvar el culo de sus corruptos, pero si ellos son ya el "nuevo PP" 100% corruption free.
Ya se desmarcaron de la chusma ladrona que trajo Aznar, que importa que los encierren, si ellos ya no tienen nada que ver
[#7](c7#c-7) Si hubiese una judicatura digna, ma√±ana mismo estaban encerrados todos los corruptos, hasta el ilocalizable M. Rajoy.
Todos los fachas son iguales ... fans de la democracia cuando ganan y todos los dem√°s son dictadores cuando pierden ... y la mierda de prensa que tenemos ayuda y mucho a esa maf√≠a.
Yo, honestamente, no estoy de acuerdo en que los pol√≠ticos sean los que elijan a los jueces porque cada legislatura ser√≠a un cachondeo poniendo jueces de tu cuerda. En ese sentido me gusta m√°s el sistema de USA de que sea vitalicio porque dejar√≠an de tener que preocuparse de las repercusiones de sus actos con respecto al que mande cada vez. Ser√≠a complicado c√≥mo elegirles, eso s√≠.
Por otro lado a ver si pod√©is responderme: ¬øes cierto que si ahora mismo el PSOE quisiera podr√≠a iniciar la renovaci√≥n proponiendo candidatos desde el Congreso y el Senado?. Porque en caso de que sea as√≠ lo que est√° claro es que no les interesa porque no saldr√≠a lo que ellos quisieran, y lo mismo ocurr√≠a en su momento con el PP y estar√≠an diciendo lo mismo los del lado contrario.
¬øNo se supone que desde la UE les han dicho que se pongan las pilas?. Mira que la pol√≠tica siempre me interes√≥ lo justo pero entre unos y otros han conseguido que, a d√≠a de hoy, mi inter√©s sea nulo.

author: Ambar Rom√°n
title: Representantes de la UE critican el excesito uso cosm√©tico de medicamentos como Ozempic
text:
Los jefes de salud europeos han lanzado una seria advertencia sobre el uso excesivo de inyecciones adelgazantes por motivos est√©ticos, se√±alando las graves consecuencias para la salud p√∫blica.
Estas inyecciones, que se administran semanalmente, est√°n dise√±adas para ayudar a pacientes con diabetes tipo 2 a controlar sus niveles de az√∫car en sangre o a personas obesas a perder peso por razones de salud.
Los medicamentos que contienen semaglutida, tirzepatida y liraglutida, conocidos comercialmente como Ozempic/Wegovy, Mounjaro y Saxenda , son considerados revolucionarios en la lucha contra la obesidad, una condici√≥n que representa costos millonarios en atenci√≥n m√©dica.
Sin embargo, la Agencia Europea de Medicamentos (EMA) ha manifestado su preocupaci√≥n por el uso de estos medicamentos entre personas no obesas sin problemas de salud relacionados con el peso. Esto ha exacerbado la escasez de medicamentos, impidiendo que los pacientes que realmente los necesitan puedan acceder a ellos, lo que representa graves consecuencias para la salud p√∫blica.
En el Reino Unido, hay una creciente preocupaci√≥n por la cantidad de personas con peso normal o bajo que requieren atenci√≥n urgente tras recibir estas inyecciones en un intento por estar ‚Äúpreparados para el cuerpo de playa‚Äù. Se cree que muchas mujeres j√≥venes obtienen estos medicamentos a trav√©s de farmacias en l√≠nea, pagando entre ¬£150 y ¬£200 por mes, tras proporcionar informaci√≥n falsa sobre su apariencia y salud. En algunos casos, se sospecha que las personas que reciben estas inyecciones sin una causa m√©dica leg√≠tima lo hacen debido a trastornos alimentarios.
La semaglutida, m√°s conocida como Ozempic, est√° disponible en el NHS desde 2019 para ayudar a los diab√©ticos tipo 2 a controlar sus niveles de az√∫car en sangre. En 2022, se aprob√≥ otro f√°rmaco basado en semaglutida para la p√©rdida de peso bajo la marca Wegovy. La tirzepatida, comercializada como Mounjaro, recibi√≥ aprobaci√≥n a principios de este a√±o para el mismo prop√≥sito. Estas inyecciones, que pertenecen a una clase de medicamentos llamados agonistas de GLP-1, ayudan a los usuarios a perder hasta 15,3 kg en promedio durante 68 semanas. Funcionan enga√±ando al cerebro para que crea que est√° lleno, reduciendo dr√°sticamente el apetito y ayudando as√≠ a las personas a perder peso.
Las pautas del NHS indican que Wegovy solo debe recetarse a pacientes con un √≠ndice de masa corporal (IMC) superior a 35, o un IMC de 30 con al menos un problema de salud relacionado con el peso, como la presi√≥n arterial alta. Aunque los prescriptores privados no est√°n obligados a seguir estas pautas, deben considerar las directrices nacionales para garantizar que solo los pacientes que realmente necesitan el medicamento tengan acceso a √©l.
La EMA ha emitido una nueva advertencia, indicando que estas inyecciones ‚Äúno est√°n aprobadas y no deben usarse para la p√©rdida de peso cosm√©tica‚Äù. Esto incluye a pacientes no obesos o aquellos con sobrepeso sin problemas de salud relacionados con el peso. En lugar de ello, los profesionales de la salud deber√≠an ofrecer consejos sobre el estilo de vida a estas personas.
Adem√°s, la EMA ha instado a los estados miembros de la UE a desarrollar directrices para priorizar a los pacientes que necesitan estos medicamentos durante la escasez. Estas directrices pueden ayudar a garantizar que los pacientes que realmente los necesitan reciban acceso a estos tratamientos esenciales en momentos de suministro limitado.

author: yahoo
title: Am√©rica: ¬°Impensable! Alexis Vega podr√≠a salir de Chivas con un r√©cord negativo ante las √Åguilas - Aguilas Monumental
text:
Liga MX Am√©rica: ¬°Impensable! Alexis Vega podr√≠a salir de Chivas con un r√©cord negativo ante las √Åguilas En los m√°s recientes a√±os, Am√©rica ha sido sumamente superior a Chivas y el claro ejemplo de ello es que ya le saca dos t√≠tulos de diferencia en la Liga MX. Mercado: Am√©rica y Atlas preparan un inesperado intercambio entre Salvador Reyes y Camilo Vargas ¬øRompe el mercado? Rayados va por un fichaje top de la Premier League Por Julio Rodriguez
28/12/2023 - 16:23hs CST
28/12/2023 - 16:23hs CST
¬© Especial Alexis Vega se puede ir de Chivas con este negativo r√©cord ante el Am√©rica Por Julio Rodriguez
Despu√©s de que Am√©rica consigui√≥ la tan ansiada 14 venciendo a Tigres por marcador de 4-1 global en la cancha del Estadio Azteca, las √Åguilas y el resto de clubes de la Liga MX ya preparan el siguiente torneo con las posibles incorporaciones que pueden hacer a su plantilla.
Respecto al cuadro azulcrema, han comenzado a sonar rumores alrededor de futbolistas que podr√≠an llegar al conjunto dirigidos por Andr√© Jardine para el Clausura 2024. Uno de los rumores que han tomado mayor fuerza, es la posible llegada de Gerardo Arteaga para cubrir la lateral izquierda, sin embargo, el alto valor del jugador podr√≠a trabar las negociaciones.
De igual manera, todo apunta a que Sebasti√°n C√°ceres ser√° la primera baja del equipo. Esto ante el gran inter√©s de clubes europeos en los servicios del central charr√∫a. No cabe duda que su convocatoria con la Selecci√≥n de Uruguay, hizo que su nivel alcanzara un pico muy alto y fuera el mejor central de Am√©rica en el Apertura 2023.
Finalmente, uno de los movimientos bomba que se espera sucedan en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as es la llegada de Alexis Vega a Cruz Azul. Luego de las m√∫ltiples pol√©micas que ha tenido con Chivas, su salida cada vez se ve m√°s cercana y La M√°quina ser√≠a el equipo interesado en √©l.

author: ACI Prensa
title: Hallan restos de monja que salv√≥ al Papa Francisco: Cornelia Caraglio | ACI Prensa
text: 14 de marzo de 2024 / 04:30 PM En 1957, una monja italiana le salv√≥ la vida a un joven de 20 a√±os que se convertir√≠a en el Vicario de Cristo en la tierra. Fallecida en 1995, su lugar de sepultura hab√≠a sido olvidado en el tiempo, pero ayer ‚Äî13 de marzo‚Äî una delegaci√≥n le inform√≥ al Papa Francisco que hab√≠an encontrado los restos mortales de Sor Cornelia Caraglio. La religiosa dominica trabajaba como enfermera en Buenos Aires (Argentina), cuando al futuro Papa ‚Äîque cursaba el segundo a√±o de estudios en el seminario diocesano‚Äî lo ingresaron muy afectado por una neumon√≠a. Al joven Bergoglio le ‚Äúsacaron litro y medio de agua del pulm√≥n‚Äù y tal era su estado de gravedad que estuvo ‚Äúluchando entre la vida y la muerte‚Äù durante meses. Cuando el seminarista estaba a punto de morir, Sor Caraglio ‚Äîcontradiciendo a los m√©dicos‚Äî le administr√≥ el doble de la dosis prescrita, porque su experiencia como monja enfermera le indicaba que el paciente no sobrevivir√≠a. Esto, al final, result√≥ en la curaci√≥n del futuro Papa, a quien terminaron por extirparle el l√≥bulo superior del pulm√≥n derecho, que estaba infectado.

author: @infobae
title: Oposici√≥n paraguaya dividida entre juicio a Pe√±a y apoyo oficial tras muerte de diputado - Infobae
text:
Asunci√≥n, 22 ago (EFE).- Legisladores de oposici√≥n en Paraguay dividieron este jueves sus opiniones tras un allanamiento que deriv√≥ en la muerte, en medio de un presunto choque con las autoridades, de un diputado en ejercicio, ya que unos respaldaron la actuaci√≥n oficial y otros pidieron someter a un juicio pol√≠tico al presidente del pa√≠s, Santiago Pe√±a.
"Para m√≠ que no ten√≠a que tener este final y este se√±or tuvo que haber sido capturado con vida", declar√≥ a los periodistas la senadora Yolanda Paredes, del Partido Cruzada Nacional (PCN), al referirse a la operaci√≥n en la vivienda del diputado Eulalio 'Lalo' Gomes, quien fue abatido en un presunto intercambio de disparos con los agentes.
Al ofrecer sus impresiones sobre una sesi√≥n extraordinaria reservada celebrada este mi√©rcoles a instancias del Senado, la opositora consider√≥ que se trat√≥ de una "quema de archivos" y advirti√≥ de que Gomes "llev√≥ a la tumba informaciones muy preciadas".
"Este se√±or pudo habernos dado nombres de personajes pol√≠ticos involucrados, porque yo no creo que √©l haya operado solo en todo este tiempo", agreg√≥ la legisladora, e indic√≥ que "esto no puede terminar as√≠".
Gomes, de 67 a√±os, fue abatido en la madrugada del lunes en medio de un procedimiento ordenado como parte de una investigaci√≥n por presunto lavado de dinero.
Las autoridades han indicado que los agentes fueron "recibidos a tiros" y "se respondi√≥ en consecuencia".
La familia alega que el pol√≠tico "no tuvo tiempo de reaccionar" y su abogado, √ìscar Tuma, ha advertido que el acta de allanamiento "tiene irregularidades".
Paredes explic√≥ que las investigaciones empezaron en 2017 y detall√≥ que desde 2021 ya se ten√≠a un expediente "con todos los antecedentes de narcotr√°fico" que presuntamente se√±alaban al legislador fallecido.
En ese sentido, la senadora afirm√≥ que la "consecuencia" de lo ocurrido debi√≥ ser un "juicio pol√≠tico al presidente de la rep√∫blica" y la destituci√≥n "en consecuencia" del ministro del Interior, Enrique Riera, y del comandante de la Polic√≠a Nacional, Carlos Ben√≠tez, al cuestionar que estas autoridades no estaban en conocimiento de la ejecuci√≥n de la operaci√≥n.
El tambi√©n senador de oposici√≥n Eduardo Nakayama dijo a la prensa que en la sesi√≥n reservada, que se prolong√≥ durante seis horas, "se evacuaron absolutamente todas las dudas".
"Yo particularmente qued√© satisfecho. Nosotros sabemos que cuando hay un allanamiento no existe el riesgo cero", sentenci√≥ Nakayama, quien record√≥ que en m√°s de una ocasi√≥n exigi√≥ al fiscal general, Emiliano Rol√≥n, actuar contra el crimen organizado y admiti√≥ que ser√≠a "muy poco coherente" si "no apoyara cuando finalmente se hace un procedimiento".
El senador Rafael Filizzola, del partido Democr√°tico Progresista, se√±al√≥ que hubo "irregularidad" en la orden judicial y en la decisi√≥n "de ingresar en horario nocturno", lo que, a su parecer, gener√≥ "un riesgo adicional que deb√≠a haber sido previsto".
No obstante, se apart√≥ de quienes piden la salida de los funcionarios, e indic√≥ que en ello radica "la diferencia entre el Senado y la C√°mara de Diputados", ya que esta √∫ltima aprob√≥ una resoluci√≥n en la que pide la dimisi√≥n de Riera y Ben√≠tez.
"El debate en este momento tiene que ser analizar por qu√© las cosas salieron como salieron y tomar medidas correctivas", afirm√≥ Filizzola, al descartar que "la destituci√≥n o la renuncia de Riera resuelva el problema". EFE
lb/jrh
(foto)

author: Artem Kamenskyi
title: My Impressions From Silent Spring Book Free Essay Example
text: 24/7 writing help on your phone Save to my list Remove from my list The book Silent Spring, written by Rachel Carson, is considered to be the forefront of the modern day environmentalist movement. In the book, she highlights the many interactions between humans and the outside, natural world, and describes the consequences of these interactions. On page 51, she explains that ‚Äúin nature, nothing exists alone.‚Äù This in and of itself describes her view of ecology. It reminds me of Newton‚Äôs Third Law, where ‚Äúevery action has an equal and opposite reaction‚Äù. For example, in chapter 3, she explains how water is contaminated by chemicals released by humans. This water, in turn, goes into the animals that not only live in it, but the ones that drink it as well. This causes damage to that animal, as well as the parasites and other predatory animals that feed on it. If said animal is up for human consumption, the chemical comes right back to where it came from, as it enters the human system and causes damage there. So, it starts out only in the water, but is spread like wildfire through organisms. This is Carson‚Äôs definition of ‚Äúecology‚Äù: no harmful interaction with nature will be contained where it starts. One core value Carson places on nature is that of anti-profitability. On page 23, she says ‚ÄúIt is also an era dominated by industry, in which the right to make a dollar at whatever cost is seldom challenged‚Äù. She is challenging the industries who seek to make a profit, even at the extreme extent of sustainable human life. The values should be reversed, whereas companies can make a profit while being life-conscious. Another value she explains is the lack of common sense. Specifically, on page 54 she says ‚Äúit is an extraordinary fact that the deliberate introduction of poisons into a reservoir is becoming a fairly common practice‚Äù. Throughout the book, she expresses her amazement to the lack of logic behind these actions. A question she has is: if we know the effects, why do we continue the practice? These arguments are definitely persuasive, as they smack the reader right in the face. She questions the logic of modern science, and that wakes many up to the problems at hand, as most people at the time trusted everything the scientists were telling them. Carson is critiquing the chemical companies, mainly. She speaks of their greed and inhumanities throughout. She recognizes that they put profit above the health of the common people. Not only this, but she critiques the scientists who allow this to happen as well. Then, at the very base of it, she critiques the government for sweeping these issues under the rug and not providing proper legislation to mitigate these issues. She critiques the chemicals themselves as well as the technology for not being environmentally conscious, and calls out those responsible. I think Carson relies on science as well as moral arguments to support her points. She uses science, for example, to explain the direct health effects DDT has on the human body. Another example is when she discusses aerial spraying, and the adverse effects on the environment there. From those scientific arguments, she turns her points toward morality. She questions why we do not put the planet we live on as the priority, because it is our only shot at life. This tugs at people‚Äôs moral strings, and attempts to pull them toward an environmental and longevity perspective rather than how to make a quick buck. Not only this, but she makes the reader feel for the animals subject to the human abuse. This tactic begins right at chapter 1, when she describes the town with the spring. After being subject to chemical spraying, the rhetoric turns dismal and describes a skeleton of the town that it once was. This struck home for me how dangerous all of these technologies were becoming, and it set the moral tone for the rest of the book. A stance on technology is never taken, although it is mentioned within the book. Carson argues that humans should not use chemistry to tamper with the natural world. She believed technological advances could easily disrupt the systems of the planet. She questioned the direction of technology down a wrong path. Once again, it worried her that the technology would be put into priority, rather than conservation. I think Silent Spring was the forefront of the movement against industrialized agribusiness, however it is still commonly practiced today. The chemicals used today are ‚Äúless‚Äù dangerous than they once were, but still cause harmful effects to the whole environment. I also think the creation of the Environmental Protection Agency was a big help to mitigate these problems and regulate the chemical industry, but it is a slow process. Not only that, but the agency ‚Äúgrandfathered‚Äù in the old chemicals that would now be illegal if invented today, to allow their continued usage, although limited. I think as the news of GMOs and CAFOs spreads like wildfire through modern media, people are fighting back strong once again, although the government still seems to be as slow moving as it was in the 1960s. The reliance on profit-only industry is still prevalent, and does not seem like it is going away anytime soon. This is demotivating politicians from making change. However, this is what must change. üëã Hi! I‚Äôm your smart assistant Amy! Don‚Äôt know where to start? Type your requirements and I‚Äôll connect you to an academic expert within 3 minutes.

author: Op-Ed
title: Op-ed: ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù or neighborhood nightmare? A look at the potential downside ‚Äì QNS.com
text:
Mayor Adams‚Äô ‚Äú City of Yes ‚Äù initiative might sound promising, but for many New Yorkers, it raises a big question: are we turning our beloved city into a chaotic mess? While fostering economic growth is important, shouldn‚Äôt it come without sacrificing our neighborhoods‚Äô character and residents‚Äô well-being? Let‚Äôs take a closer look at some potential downsides of ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù that deserve more attention.
Brownstoner Podcast: Compass‚Äô Zolan Rossiter Team Meets the Moment Schneps Connects https://podcasts.schnepsmedia.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Schneps-Connects-Podcast-Brownstoner-1.mp3 Subscribe: RSS iTunes Spotify Stitcher Amazon Google Play
Unchecked Development and Uncertain Futures:
Imagine bustling massage parlors and late-night corner stores popping up on your quiet street corner. The ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù could turn peaceful residential areas into commercial zones, driving up noise, traffic and congestion. This rapid, unregulated development could also push property values and rents sky-high, displacing long-time residents who can no longer afford their own homes. Remember the recent uproar over migrants at Creedmoor ? They‚Äôre just one example of our Eastern Queens communities worried about losing their cherished sense of suburbia.
Silencing Neighborhood Voices:
Say goodbye to community input under ‚ÄúCity of Yes.‚Äù The plan aims to fast-track development approvals, potentially sidelining vital public review processes like ULURP (Uniform Land Use Review Procedure). This means projects would be decided behind closed doors, ignoring the needs and concerns of residents who know their neighborhoods best. Remember, lively street-level retail is great, but not if it means towering apartment complexes built right on top, casting shadows and squeezing out green spaces.
Prioritizing Profits over People:
Let‚Äôs be honest, ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù seems to favor developers and corporations over ordinary residents. Streamlined approvals and relaxed regulations could open the door for projects that prioritize profit over community well-being. Imagine cookie-cutter storefronts replacing local businesses, or parking lots replacing playgrounds. These might bring in more tax revenue, but at what cost to the soul of our neighborhoods?
A Better Way Forward:
We can support economic growth while protecting our communities. Instead of a rush to ‚ÄúYes,‚Äù we need a balanced approach that prioritizes responsible development. This means ensuring safeguards against displacement, preserving community input and focusing on projects that benefit residents, not just developers. Let‚Äôs demand responsible development that respects our neighborhoods, preserves green spaces and strengthens our sense of community.
Conclusion:
Saying ‚ÄúNo‚Äù to ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù doesn‚Äôt mean saying no to progress. It means saying yes to thoughtful, mindful development that puts people first. We deserve a city that thrives while embracing its diverse communities, not one that sacrifices our neighborhoods for quick profits.
Our voices matter. This is not just about saying ‚ÄúNo‚Äù to the ‚ÄúCity of Yes,‚Äù it‚Äôs about demanding the future we deserve. Here‚Äôs what you can do: Contact your elected officials. Let them know your concerns about the ‚ÄúCity of Yes‚Äù and urge them to advocate for responsible development that prioritizes community well-being. Join a local civic group. Connecting with others who share your concerns can amplify your voice and give you access to resources and support. Attend public hearings and meetings. Make your voice heard in person by participating with your civics, community groups and elected officials in official discussions about development plans. Share your story on social media. Spread awareness and encourage others to get involved by using the hashtag #Saveourcommunity and tagging your elected officials.
George Peters of Bellerose is a retired commercial real estate professional with a longstanding passion for local development.

author: @onlymyhealth
title: Ammonia Gas Leak Near Ennore Raises Health Concerns: Signs Of Ammonia In The Lungs And How To Treat It | Onlymyhealth
text: On the night of December 26, 2023, a significant ammonia gas leak from an underwater pipeline near Periyakuppam in Ennore sent shockwaves through the community, leading to widespread panic and health concerns. Residents reported difficulty in breathing and burning sensations in their eyes and faces, prompting hospitalizations and raising questions about the immediate and long-term effects of ammonia exposure. Community Outcry and Environmental Concerns Leaders from the fishing community in Ennore demanded that the area be declared affected by industrial accidents. They called for action against the responsible companies and compensation for those affected by the ammonia gas leak. Despite containment efforts, the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board recorded elevated levels of ammonia in the air and sea, surpassing safety standards. The incident has ignited concerns about both public health and environmental well-being, emphasizing the need for swift action and accountability. Understanding Ammonia: A Colorless Hazard Ammonia, a colorless gas with a strong odor, is a naturally occurring chemical found in the environment, including air, water, and soil. While it is present in plants, animals, and humans, it is also commonly used in various industrial and household cleaning products. Exposure to high levels of ammonia can result in irritation of the throat, lungs, mouth, skin, and eyes, with severe exposure potentially causing lung damage and, in extreme cases, fatalities. Also Read: [Risk Factors For Lung Cancer In Non-Smokers](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/risk-factors-for-lung-cancer-in-non-smokers-1699342625) Signs of Ammonia Exposure in the Lungs When ammonia enters the lungs, it can lead to short- or long-term respiratory problems. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) highlights the immediate effects, including burning sensations in the throat and windpipe, swelling of airways, and potential corrosion of lung membranes. Prolonged exposure may lead to respiratory distress, asphyxiation, and, in children, increased vulnerability due to higher concentrations near the ground. Symptoms of ammonia in the lungs may manifest as a burning throat, coughing, difficulty breathing, a tight chest, altered mental state, runny nose, eye irritation, and skin burns. The severity of these symptoms depends on factors such as the concentration and duration of exposure. Also Read: [Lung Health: 7 Different Ways To Know Your Lungs Are Functioning Properly](https://www.onlymyhealth.com/different-ways-to-know-your-lungs-are-functioning-properly-1694428138) Treating Ammonia Exposure Immediate medical attention is crucial for those exposed to ammonia, especially if symptoms of lung involvement are present. First aid measures include moving the affected person to an area with fresh air, keeping airways open, and providing respiratory support. Medical professionals may conduct physical examinations and tests, including blood and urine tests, to assess the extent of exposure and lung damage. While there is no specific antidote for ammonia poisoning, treatment focuses on managing and reducing the injury caused by exposure. This may involve supplying humidified oxygen, using bronchodilators to ease breathing, and diluting ingested ammonia with water or milk. Prevention and Protective Measures Preventing ammonia exposure involves avoiding high-risk settings and using protective equipment such as respirators, clothing, gloves, and eye protection. Swift reporting of leaks or spills, proper labeling and storage of ammonia containers, and decontamination measures contribute to minimizing risks. The recent ammonia gas leak near Ennore serves as a stark reminder of the potential health hazards posed by industrial incidents. Understanding the signs of ammonia exposure in the lungs and knowing how to treat it are crucial aspects of ensuring the well-being of affected individuals. As communities and authorities grapple with the aftermath of such events, proactive measures, accountability, and public awareness become essential in preventing and mitigating the impact of ammonia leaks on both human health and the environment.
